Matcha tea is the highest grade used for the tea ceremony. During 
harvesti=
ng only the small stems called tencha are used. Everyday 
table tea is call=
ed bancha. The lowest grade generally harvested 
from the second or third c=
utting season. The first cutting in April 
is the best and brings the major=
ity of the farmer's annual income. A 
step up from Bancha is Sencha harvest=
ed from the top two leaves of 
the tea bush. Here in Shizuoka Japan we grow=
 gyokuro tea which is 
another fine grade of tea. Also using only the first=
 cutting the 
leaves are shaded two to three weeks before harvesting. This =
process 
locks in the flavor. Inbetween these types are many mixes to produ=
ce 
unique flavors. If you are interested I could explain each in 
detail. =


Hirai
